body_html:
Okay, I think I found that it is the timestamps, I wrote it down here: https://medium.com/@mauddev/about-rspec-timestamps-and-postgresql-7bbb0e020a7b

And about the method stub: I tested it in the all the other switch specs. It works everywhere except in the last two. Rspec says about stubbing the method: " Nothing happens if the message is never received." And that is exactly what the silent fail does, isn't it? Redirecting without sending the message.

Mystery solved?
body_text:
Okay, I think I found that it is the timestamps, I wrote it down here: https://medium.com/@mauddev/about-rspec-timestamps-and-postgresql-7bbb0e020a7b
And about the method stub: I tested it in the all the other switch specs. It works everywhere except in the last two. Rspec says about stubbing the method: " Nothing happens if the message is never received." And that is exactly what the silent fail does, isn't it? Redirecting without sending the message.
Mystery solved?
body:
Okay, I think I found that it _is_ the timestamps, I wrote it down here: https://medium.com/@mauddev/about-rspec-timestamps-and-postgresql-7bbb0e020a7b

And about the method stub: I tested it in the all the other switch specs. It works everywhere except in the last two. Rspec [says about stubbing the method:](https://www.relishapp.com/rspec/rspec-mocks/v/2-14/docs/method-stubs/stub-on-any-instance-of-a-class) " Nothing happens if the message is never received." And that is exactly what the silent fail does, isn't it? Redirecting without sending the message.  

Mystery solved?
